importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the most recent update on college football game outcomes and rankings.
Nebraska's next scheduled game against Northwestern, showing the timeline of upcoming matchups in the college football season.
The date of Minnesota's upcoming game against Iowa, indicating a key scheduling point for the Big Ten conference.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which key matchups and team performances are being evaluated, including the aftermath of Minnesota's win over Nebraska and the scheduling of future games.

keyTakeAways: Minnesota defeated Nebraska 24-6 in a Big Ten matchup, marking their sixth straight win over the Cornhuskers.
Darius Taylor had a breakout performance with 148 rushing yards and a touchdown, reaching 2,000 career rushing yards in 23 games.
Drake Lindsey completed 16 of 20 passes for 153 yards and a touchdown, including a key 20-yard touchdown pass to Le’Meke Brockington.
Minnesota recorded a school-record nine sacks on quarterback Dylan Raiola, with Anthony Smith and Karter Menz each contributing 2.5 sacks.
Nebraska was held to a season-low 36 yards rushing and failed to score a touchdown for the first time since 2016.
Nebraska's offensive line suffered injuries, including guard Rocco Spindler (broken finger) and tackle Elijah Pritchett (ejected for targeting).
Minnesota's defense was highlighted as a major factor in the victory, with the team outgaining Nebraska 186-36 on the ground.
The game marked Minnesota's 7-1 record against Nebraska, with no wins in Minneapolis since 2015.
Head coach P.J. Fleck praised the team’s defense and performance, calling it a 'complete defense' effort.
Coach Matt Rhule addressed rumors about his candidacy for Penn State's head coach position, citing team performance and injuries as challenges.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Minnesota's Golden Gophers defeated Nebraska 24-6 in a Big Ten game, marking their sixth straight win over the Cornhuskers. Darius Taylor rushed for 148 yards and a touchdown, while Drake Lindsey completed 16 of 20 passes for a score. Minnesota recorded a school-record nine sacks on Nebraska quarterback Dylan Raiola, with Anthony Smith and Karter Menz each contributing 2.5 sacks. The Gophers held Nebraska to a season-low 36 yards rushing and failed to score a touchdown for the first time since 2016. Nebraska’s offensive line was impacted by injuries, including guard Rocco Spindler (broken finger) and tackle Elijah Pritchett (ejected for targeting). Minnesota head coach P.J. Fleck improved to 7-1 against Nebraska and praised the team's complete defensive performance. Meanwhile, Nebraska head coach Matt Rhule addressed rumors of his candidacy for Penn State’s head coaching job, citing team struggles as key factors. The game underscores Minnesota’s growing defensive dominance and offensive consistency, while highlighting Nebraska’s ongoing challenges due to injuries and inconsistent line play.
title: Minnesota Beats Nebraska 24-6 in Big Ten Matchup
